column4: anyone have any experience in methods of cloning a mounted drive?
what do you mean?  and no, you don't want to use dd
I have five PC's that can't boot from externals... and I want to clone the heavily customized ubuntu acreoss them
if you want to create a backup image of your drive, you want something like partimage, or g4l which uses it... which you can find on the parted magic livecd
then how do you propose to boot?
my idea is to somehow clone the customised one onto the other one using my external bay
yea... and how are you goign to do that if it has no bootable os and no way to boot from external media?
does the machine have a usb port?  you could boot from a usb stick

what IS it booting from then?  if it can't boot from anything but the internal disk, which has no os, then you can't install an os.. chicken and egg problem...
they're FIT-PC2's, and they came with Ubuntu 9.10 installed. I suppose I may be better off just trying to make a shell script to do all my customization...
then they plugged the disk into another machine to load it first... maybe you could do the same then?

you have a desktop right?  pull the disk out of this other machine and plug it into yuor desktop... create a partimage from the disk you have set up, then plug in the other disk and dump the image back
